title: Can you name a successful episodic web series that is not a comedy? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many successful original episodic web series in the Horror Genre. Several can be found on Fearnet.com: http://www.fearnet.com/shows/index.html The most popular Horror web series are spin offs from movies and television: 30 Days of Night: Blood Trails: http://www.fearnet.com/shows/30_days_of_night_blood_trails/index.htmlThe Walking Dead Webisodes - made exclusively for the net:http://www.amctv.com/the-walking-dead/videos/the-walking-dead-webisodes-1-a-new-dayMachinima.com makes popular webisodes in many genres, Sci-Fi in particular:  RCVR:  These types of shows are "successful" in that both Fearnet.com and Machinima.com are successful businesses that continue to expand.

How are you defining successful?  What does that mean to you?  The act  of just completing any production is a success so one could say any web  series is successful. It's a subjective question so you  need to be more specific on what you mean.  Do you define success as  starting a self-sustaining business, selling your series to a TV  network, getting YouTube  views, getting YouTube Subscribers, getting brand deals, getting paid,  getting an agent, getting a girl to like you, creating a calling card,  practicing your craft, etc.? Until you can get a clear idea of what your definition of success is, the best people can do is guess or give  examples of what successful means to them, which may not be the answers  you're looking for.

Several. Halo: Forward Unto Dawn, BlackBoxTV, RCVR, The Booth at the End, Anyone But Me, The Bannen Way, Continuum, the aforementioned Sanctuary and Mortal Kombat, and there are plenty more. Genre isn't a determinate of success online as this question seems to suggest. The delivery medium is (kind of) different, but the type of shows people like to watch has not. Entertainment is entertainment.

I've referenced this in other answers but Mortal Kombat: Legacy [1] is surely a worthy answer to the question.  Background and links to the films in the citation below (not directly linked to as potentially NSFW or kiddies: violence).  [1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortal_Kombat:_Legacy

Glitchtale. It’s an undertale fan series on youtube, and it is phenomenal. It hasn’t made me laugh though, because it isn’t supposed to. But even if you don’t like undertale, I suggest giving glitchtale a try. It will hit you hard in the feels, though.
Sanctuary http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sanctuary_(TV_series)    It was originally an eight webisode series that became so successful that SyFy picked it up as Television Series.
